data.event: The county was formed in 1838 and was named for William Grayson Carter, a state senator at the time of its creation.
Carter County was formed on February 9, 1838 from portions of Greenup County and Lawrence County.
The original courthouse was rebuilt in 1907.
Within the city of Grayson after a vote on June 11, 2013 approved full retail alcohol sales within the city limits by a vote of 511 in favor of alcohol sales to 393 against.
